Incident.Summary: Members of the Firearm Enforcement Unit conducted an investigation in reference to a prohibited suspect, Matthew Christian Paul (White/Male DOB: 3/27/1980). Through the investigation, it was learned that Paul is a prohibited person, who pawned a firearm.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: NARRATIVE: On May 3, 2023, members of the Firearms Enforcement Unit wereconducting firearm-related entriesonthe Regional Automated Property Information Database (RAPID) for any and all firearm-related transactions. Investigators observed the following firearm transactions conducted by Matthew Christian PAUL (White/Male DOB: 3/27/1980) on April 29, 2023. PAUL conducted the firearm transaction at BJs Furniture T/A Crazy Louies Pawn Shop located at 2614 North Salisbury Boulevard, Wicomico County, Maryland 21801. Source Transaction Number: 24916966 Ticket: 117534 Make: Marlin Model: Boltmarlin 81 Caliber: 22 Serial Number: Pre-serial Due to the above, investigators conducted a check on PAUL through Maryland Judiciary Case Search, revealing criminal-related cases. From FEU members training, knowledge, and experience led investigators to believe PAUL is a prohibited person in the State of Maryland. FEU members contacted the Maryland Gun Center and requested a prohibited check revealing that PAUL does not have a handgun permit issued by the Maryland State Police Licensing Division appearing in MAFSS. In addition, PAUL was queried through various criminal justice databases including the Maryland Department of Health which revealed negative results. The Maryland Gun Center revealed that PAUL is a PROHIBITED person from possessing firearm(s) and ammunition in the state of Maryland for the following convictions/conditions: Name: Matthew Christian PAUL Date of Birth: 03/27/1980 Address: 245 Hampshire Road, Salisbury, Wicomico County, Maryland 21801 Driver s License Number: P-400-589-115-244 Height and Weight: 600 200lbs County: Wicomico SID Number: MD1844838 Other SID Number: PA29676160 Other SID Number: NJ566678C Other SID Number: DE00820314 FBI Number: 3762PB2 Prohibiting Factors (3) STATE OF MARYLAND I) Convicted of a misdemeanor with more than 2 years imprisonment 2) Convicted of a disqualifying crime classified as a felony 3) Convicted of a crime of violence Conviction Date: 8/04/2003 Court:Other State: Pennsylvania County: Bucks Case: CP-09-CR-0003053-2003 Offense: Simple Assault Offense: Simple Assault Conviction Date: 3/29/2004 Court:Other State: Pennsylvania County: Bucks Case: CP-09-CR-000173-2004 Offense: Indecent Assault Offense: Indecent Assault Offense: Indecent Assault Offense: Sexual Assault Conviction Date: 12/27/2018 Court:District State: Maryland County: Wicomico Case: D-023-CR-18-002512 Offense: Assault-2 Degree On May 3, 2023, investigatorscontacted the store employee manager, Cameron Davis, at BJs Furniture T/A Crazy Louies Pawn Shop and explained the nature of the investigation. Davis acknowledged and provided investigators with the transaction documentation referencing the firearm pawned by PAUL. These documents of PAUL positively identified an exact match to the prohibited individual as provided by the Maryland Gun Center and the documentation of the RAPID database. The Wicomico County States Attorneys Office was contacted and presented the facts of the case. After a conversation, it was determined the StatesAttorneys Office agreed and wished to pursue charges against PAUL. Investigators authored an application of charges, which an arrest warrant granted by the Wicomico County Commissioner. On 5/10/2023 investigators contacted the Maryland State Police Salisbury Barrack and collaborated with TFC Eckrich in assisting in serving the arrest warrant. At approximately 2130 hours PAUL was arrested without incident. PAUL was transported to the Maryland State Police Salisbury Barrack, processed per MSP policy, presented to the Wicomico County Commissioner, and was held without bond. All the above events occurred in Wicomico County, Maryland. Case Closed.
